results.title: City centre developments (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Open University, BBC-TV, Alberta Educational Commission Corp and Graeme Turner
results.brief_description: Looks at capitalist Vancouver, mixed economy Birmingham and socialist Cracow, noting the influences which cause city centres to change in character, function and population.

results.title: City bound
results.creator_credit: Spectator Productions, Denning Films, Ivan Scott and Robin Carruthers
results.brief_description: A study of London’s transport system during World War II. Between 5.30am and 10.00am each morning London’s underground and above-ground transport fleet carried nearly five million workers to city offices, shops, factories, and dockyards; many of these people lived in the most distant residential outer suburbs of London, and were brought in to the city every day from distances of up to 30 miles or more away. “City bound” shows us the daily migration by train, tram, bus, and tube.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Spectator Productions, Denning Films, Ivan Scott and Robin Carruthers

results.title: Citizens in uniform
results.brief_description: The soldier of the Bundeswehr has to submit to a hard training suitable to meet the requirements of a technical age. He also has rights which underline his equal position as a citizen. As a member of the North Atlantic Treaty Organization, the German Republic must contribute its share against the Communist threat.

results.title: Citizen soldier
results.creator_credit: Telemark Productions, Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and Greg Reading
results.brief_description: An impression of the life throughout the year of a citizen soldier in the Citizens Military Forces. It delves into such aspects as how effective CMF training really is, why it is important to the individual and the country and what it offers to the soldier and to his employer.

results.title: Citizen Kane (TEFC)
results.brief_description: A faceless journalist sets out to investigate the life of media magnate and failed politician Charles Foster Kane. He seeks to uncover the meaning of “rosebud”, Kane’s last utterance. In turn satire, tragedy and gothic comedy, Citizen Kane is a triumph of disjointed, non-linear narrative in which the form becomes the theme, an ironic reflection upon the success ethic and the crushing weight of materialism. In drawing upon the tradition of classical narrative, while at the same time violating some of the expectations in the viewer’s reception of such narrative, Welles ultimately assured “Citizen Kane” of its place as a watershed in modern cinema. Credits: script-Herman J. Mankiewicz, Orson Welles; music-Bernard Hermann; photography-Gregg Toland; editors-Robert Wise, Mark Robson. Cast includes: Orson Welles, Joseph Cotten, Agnes Moorehead, Dorothy Comingore, Ray Collins, Everett Sloane.

results.title: Citizen Kane
results.brief_description: Shrouded in darkness and fog is the huge mansion called Xanadu. We pass through the iron gates which forbid our entry and approach the grotesque structure. In a dark room, an old man, the master of the extravagant folly, lies dying. As his life ebbs away, a crystal ball containing a snow scene crashes to the floor and is shattered. He utters one plaintive whisper “Rosebud”. Now we are beginning one of the most fantastic experiences of all time - the masterpiece and first feature written, produced and directed by Orson Welles. Rated: PG

results.title: Citizen Harold
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Robert Verrall and Hugh Foulds
results.brief_description: An animated satire about one man’s attempt to bring changes in his community through participation with fellow citizens and the local government. A discussion starter with a dual ending, for groups exploring methods of bringing about change. (Awards: New York, Melbourne, Columbus.)

results.title: Citizen army
results.brief_description: The Citizen Military Forces form an important part of Australia’s defence program. This film shows the men of the CMF, citizens in uniform, in a mock assault on an objective during training.

results.title: Cities in crisis: what's happening?
results.creator_credit: Universal City Studios Productions and Ray Witlin
results.brief_description: The first in a series dealing with environmental pollution. this film juxtaposes scenes of congestion, pollution, and decay which are the results of uncontrolled growth, inadequate planning and insufficient concern in a sprawling metropolitan city. Exposes the social, economic and moral values that have permitted the megalopolis to arise. No spoken commentary.

results.title: Cities in crisis II: a matter of survival
results.creator_credit: Universal Education and Visual Arts and Ray Witlin
results.brief_description: Alarming levels of pollution parallel with urban and industrial growth are being recorded in the metropolitan areas of the United States. Land, air, water and the human ear are victims of this pollution. This film contrasts scenes of rural beauty accompanied by readings from Walt Whitman with the rising accumulations of refuse and decay that threaten the nation’s health.
